main event: On July 7, 1952, at approximately 1710 hours, a bright light was observed hovering over the Jersey City skyline for approximately 10 minutes before suddenly accelerating and disappearing from view.
interesting points: The bright light appeared to be approximately 500 feet in diameter and emitted a bright glow.
The observer was unable to determine the altitude or distance of the object due to the lack of familiar reference points.
After a thorough investigation, Project Blue Book classified the observed object as an 'unidentified flying object' (UFO).

The sighting was also reported on January 7, 1952, where an object described as round, white in color, and exhibiting a pulsating or flickering motion was observed for approximately 5 minutes before disappearing from view.
The witness who reported the sighting was a housewife.
sighted object: bright light approximately 500 feet in diameter and emitting a bright glow
